result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas E Geurkink

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 27, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

8:16 AM Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Thomas E Geurkink.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. V. Girard - Clerk 
22CF159, 22CF203, 22CF228, 22CF254, 22CF283, 22CF302, 22CF321, 22CF328, 22CM124, 22FO638
Atty Rivard - did speak with Mr. Geurkink yesterday- not sure of his position
Deft - not competent because being forced to take medicine
Atty Rivard - have read Dr. Minter's report - no agreement
Court - swears Dr. Minter on - appearance by zoom
State direct questions Dr. Minter
8:23 am Atty Rivard to cross
8:26 am Court questions Dr. Minter
Court receives & makes part of the record in the criminal cases the report filed by Dr. Minter
8:27 am Witness excused
Parties make arguments

Court - addresses jail credit - 22CF159, 22CF203, 22CF228, 22CF254, 22CF283, 
22CF302, 22CF321, 
22CF328 finds 40 days credit
Court has discussion re: jail incident - has deuterated significantly in mental health since being in custody
  did appoint him counsel without an application
  Finds he is not competent but likely to become competent within the next 12 months
  Lacks competency to stand trial

Have reviewed the criminal complaints, finds probable cause in Br 1 cases 22CF328 - has not been released after alleged Sept 17th incident
  Commit to Dept of Health services and see if restored competency within 12 months
  Finds he is mentally ill - is not competent to refuse medications - medications may be administered
  The criminal proceedings are suspended - Dept of Health services to submit 3 months, 6 months, 9 month, 12 month report
  To be transported forthwith
Status conference scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

22CF159, 22CF203, 22CF228, 22CF254, 22CF283,22CF302, 22CF321, 22CF328, 22CM124, 22FO638

State - did not receive report yet
Deft speaks

Determination of Eligibility for Public Defender Services

3:13 PM Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared by video in custody from DC Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius appears by Zoom.  V. Girard - Clerk 
22CF159, 22CF203, 22CF228, 22CF328, 22CM124
Court - 22CF328 INIT
Atty Satorius - special appearance for today - still would qualify - at this time will find another attorney given the volume of cases
  Have recd copy of the complaint
Court - is anyone raising competence at this point
Atty Satorius - not at this time
State - don't have enough knowledge - seems somewhat rational but hostile
Court - feels reason to doubt competency at this time - he is in jail, still talking but muted
Deft - doesn't feel he is competent
Court - orders comp eval on all cases- reviewed complaint & finds probable cause - bonds cont.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared in person. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. V. Girard - Clerk 
22CF159, 22CF203, 22CM124
Atty Tomtschik - Waive reading & time limits in CF cases - & waive reading, speedy trial, enter NG pleas
Court - bond cont
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on June 28, 2022 at 11:10 am. Clerk mailed NOH and Complaint on 6/16/22.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas E Geurkink appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears in person. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF203, 22CM124

Court - notes 22CF159 is a Branch 1 case. Atty Shelly Tomtschik appeared and noted DE did not want to speak to her. Bond was posted in that case. Speaks of filing in 22CF203 yesterday requesting a cash bond and released into the care of Mr. Lawrence Thomas. Mr. Thomas was provided with the Zoom information to appear today.

Atty Lundeen - has not spoken with defendant.
State - rcvd call from DE's brother. Concerned of meth in 22CF159 matter. 22CF203 asks for $500 cash bond. Brother is willing to post bond.
Atty Lundeen - has no record of meeting with DE. PD's office noted that DE was directed to contact their office to qualify. 
Court - orders $500 cash bond on 22CF203. Sets Adjourned Initial Appearance for tomorrow at 1:15 PM. Asks Atty Lundeen to speak to DE.
Atty Lundeen - will go to jail to contact defendant.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
